results.title: Low dosage combination treatment with metformin and simvastatin inhibits obesity-promoted pancreatic cancer development in male KrasG12D mice
results.text_hl: Inset: Dose response of @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@) without or with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Sim@@@).

results.title: Statins Inhibit Inflammatory Cytokine Production by Macrophages and Acinar-to-Ductal Metaplasia of Pancreatic Cells
results.text_hl: Further analysis of the pancreatic specimens in this current study revealed that oral administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ decreased the formation of metaplastic/neoplastic ADM and @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@PanIN lesions@@@ in KC @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Ako S, Teper Y, Ye L, Sinnett-Smith J, Hines OJ, Rozengurt E, Eibl G. Statins Inhibit Inflammatory Cytokine Production by Macrophages and Acinar-to-Ductal Metaplasia of Pancreatic Cells Gastro Hep Adv. 2022;1(4):640-651. PMID: 36313271

results.title: Simvastatin delay progression of pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia and cancer formation in a genetically engineered mouse model of pancreatic cancer.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ delay progression of @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia@@@ and @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ formation in a genetically engineered @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model of @DISEASE_Pancreatic_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D010190 @@@pancreatic cancer@@@.

citations.NLM: Fendrich V, Sparn M, Lauth M, Knoop R, Plassmeier L, Bartsch DK, Waldmann J. Simvastatin delay progression of pancreatic intraepithelial neoplasia and cancer formation in a genetically engineered mouse model of pancreatic cancer. Pancreatology. 2013 Sep-Oct;13(5):502-7. results.title: Breast ductal lavage for biomarker assessment in high risk women: rationale, design and methodology of a randomized phase II clinical trial with nimesulide, simvastatin and placebo
results.text_hl: From 2005 to 2011, 150 @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with a history of @GENE_ESR1 @GENE_2099 @@@estrogen receptor@@@ negative @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@ductal intraepithelial neoplasia@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Uterine_Cervical_Dysplasia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002578 @@@lobular intraepithelial neoplasia@@@ or @DISEASE_Endometrial_Hyperplasia @DISEASE_MESH:D004714 @@@atypical hyperplasia@@@, or unaffected subjects carrying a mutation of @GENE_BRCA1 @GENE_672 @@@BRCA1@@@ or with a probability of mutation >10% (according to BRCAPRO) were randomized to receive @CHEMICAL_nimesulide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C012655 @@@nimesulide@@@ 100mg/day versus @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 20mg/day versus placebo for one year followed by a second year of follow-up.

citations.NLM: Lazzeroni M, Guerrieri-Gonzaga A, Serrano D, Cazzaniga M, Mora S, Casadio C, Jemos C, Pizzamiglio M, Cortesi L, Radice D, Bonanni B. Breast ductal lavage for biomarker assessment in high risk women: rationale, design and methodology of a randomized phase II clinical trial with nimesulide, simvastatin and placebo BMC Cancer. 2012 Dec 5;12():575. PMID: 23216985
